description: Returns detailed information about a compute node group. This API action provides networking information, EC2 instance type, compute node group status, and scheduler (such as Slurm) configuration.

parameters.name: clusterIdentifier
parameters.description: The name or ID of the cluster.

parameters.name: computeNodeGroupIdentifier
parameters.description: The name or ID of the compute node group.

nested_items.name: computeNodeGroup
nested_items.description: A compute node group associated with a cluster.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name that identifies the compute node group.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The generated unique ID of the compute node group.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the compute node group.

nested_items.name: clusterId
nested_items.description: The ID of the cluster of the compute node group.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The date and time the resource was created.

nested_items.name: modifiedAt
nested_items.description: The date and time the resource was modified.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The provisioning status of the compute node group.

nested_items.name: amiId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Amazon Machine Image (AMI) that Amazon Web Services PCS uses to launch instances. If not provided, Amazon Web Services PCS uses the AMI ID specified in the custom launch template.

nested_items.name: subnetIds
nested_items.description: The list of subnet IDs where instances are provisioned by the compute node group. The subnets must be in the same VPC as the cluster.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: purchaseOption
nested_items.description: Specifies how EC2 instances are purchased on your behalf. Amazon Web Services PCS supports On-Demand and Spot instances. For more information, see Instance purchasing options in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide. If you don't provide this option, it defaults to On-Demand.

nested_items.name: customLaunchTemplate
nested_items.description: An Amazon EC2 launch template Amazon Web Services PCS uses to launch compute nodes.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The ID of the EC2 launch template to use to provision instances.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: The version of the EC2 launch template to use to provision instances.

nested_items.name: iamInstanceProfileArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM instance profile used to pass an IAM role when launching EC2 instances. The role contained in your instance profile must have the pcs:RegisterComputeNodeGroupInstance permission. The resource identifier of the ARN must start with AWSPCS or it must have /aws-pcs/ in its path.
arn:aws:iam::111122223333:instance-profile/AWSPCS-example-role-1
arn:aws:iam::111122223333:instance-profile/aws-pcs/example-role-2

nested_items.name: scalingConfiguration
nested_items.description: Specifies the boundaries of the compute node group auto scaling.

nested_items.name: minInstanceCount
nested_items.description: The lower bound of the number of instances allowed in the compute fleet.

nested_items.name: maxInstanceCount
nested_items.description: The upper bound of the number of instances allowed in the compute fleet.

nested_items.name: instanceConfigs
nested_items.description: A list of EC2 instance configurations that Amazon Web Services PCS can provision in the compute node group.

nested_items.name: instanceType
nested_items.description: The EC2 instance type that Amazon Web Services PCS can provision in the compute node group.

nested_items.name: spotOptions
nested_items.description: Additional configuration when you specify SPOT as the purchaseOption for the CreateComputeNodeGroup API action.

nested_items.name: allocationStrategy
nested_items.description: The Amazon EC2 allocation strategy Amazon Web Services PCS uses to provision EC2 instances. Amazon Web Services PCS supports lowest price, capacity optimized, and price capacity optimized. For more information, see Use allocation strategies to determine how EC2 Fleet or Spot Fleet fulfills Spot and On-Demand capacity in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide. If you don't provide this option, it defaults to price capacity optimized.

nested_items.name: slurmConfiguration
nested_items.description: Additional options related to the Slurm scheduler.

nested_items.name: slurmCustomSettings
nested_items.description: Additional Slurm-specific configuration that directly maps to Slurm settings.

nested_items.name: parameterName
nested_items.description: Amazon Web Services PCS supports configuration of the following Slurm parameters:

nested_items.name: clusters
nested_items.description: Prolog.
Prolog.
Epilog.
SelectTypeParameters.

nested_items.name: compute node groups
nested_items.description: Weight.
Weight.
RealMemory.

nested_items.name: parameterValue
nested_items.description: The values for the configured Slurm settings.

nested_items.name: errorInfo
nested_items.description: The list of errors that occurred during compute node group provisioning.

nested_items.name: code
nested_items.description: The short-form error code.

nested_items.name: message
nested_items.description: The detailed error information.
